revised_title: Tetrahymena dimorpha: A New Ciliate Parasite of Simuliidae and Its Potential for Studying Ciliate Morphogenesis
tldr: The article describes the discovery of a new ciliate species, Tetrahymena dimorpha, which is a parasite of Simuliidae (Diptera) insects. The ciliate exhibits remarkable dimorphism, with different morphological forms in larval and adult hosts. The author discusses the potential of this organism as a model for studying ciliate morphogenesis and other biological processes.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ciliate Biology
